title: How to Sign Into X (Twitter) + Troubleshooting

steps.title: Go to the X website in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to the X website in a web browser. You can use any supported browser, such as Safari, Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, or another browser.

steps.title: Click Sign in.
steps.content: Click Sign in . This can be found at the center of the page. If you don't have an account, you can select Create account , Sign up with Google , or Sign up with Apple to create one . If you are already logged into an X account, click the "•••" next to your profile at the bottom-left corner. Click Log out @(username) to sign out, or click Add an existing account to log into multiple accounts at once.

steps.title: Enter your phone, email, or username.
steps.content: Enter your phone, email, or username. You can also click Sign in with Google or Sign in with Apple if you created an X account with your Gmail or Apple ID.

steps.title: Enter your password.
steps.content: Enter your password. If you've forgotten your password, click the Forgot password? link. You will be asked to enter your email address, X username, or phone number to begin the password reset process. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Log in.
steps.content: Click Log in . This is the white button at the bottom of the pop-up window. If you entered your login information correctly, you will be taken to your X home page, where you will see the most recent posts from the people you follow. You can now use X to share photos, make friends , and more.

steps.title: Open the X app.
steps.content: Open the X app. This looks like a white X with a black background. When you start X for the first time, you will be given the option to create a new account or sign in with an existing account. If you are using a Google device, you may be asked if you would like to create a new account with your Google address. X is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Tap Log in.
steps.content: Tap Log in . This button is located at the bottom of the login page. If you're already logged into an X account, you can sign out, or you can log in with a second (or more) X account. To sign out, tap your profile picture in the top-left corner. Tap Settings and privacy > Your account > Account information > Log out . To sign into another account, tap your profile picture in the top-left corner, and then tap the three-dot icon. Tap Add an existing account . You can also tap Create a new account to make a new one.

steps.title: Enter your phone, email, or username.
steps.content: Enter your phone, email, or username. If you have all three linked to your X account, use any one of them. When you're finished, tap Next .

steps.title: Enter your password.
steps.content: Enter your password. If you've forgotten your password, click the Forgot password? link. You will be asked to enter your email address, X username, or phone number to begin the password reset process. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Log in.
steps.content: Tap Log in . This is the button at the bottom of the screen. If you entered your login information correctly, you will be taken to your X home page, where you will see the most recent posts from the people you follow.

steps.title: Visit a site that uses X to log in.
steps.content: Visit a site that uses X to log in. Many sites that allow comments on articles or other forms of community interaction allow you to sign in with your X account. This can save you time and keep the number of different profiles you have online to a minimum. Make sure the site you are signing into is a trustworthy site. By connecting your X account, you could potentially be revealing personal information and connections.

steps.title: Click the "Login with X" button.
steps.content: Click the "Login with X" button. The functionality will vary from site to site, but generally, there will be a button with the X logo that you can use to log in with your X account. This will only be available for sites that allow it. While there are lots of sites with X connectivity, there are plenty of sites that require you to create an account with them.

steps.title: Enter your login information in the new window.
steps.content: Enter your login information in the new window. When you choose to log in with X, a new window will appear. This window comes from X and displays what information the site will be able to access from your profile. Be sure to review this information before entering your login details.

steps.title: Use the site.
steps.content: Use the site. Once you've logged in with your X account, you can begin posting and interacting with the site. Generally, your username on the site will be the same as your X username, though some sites allow you to change it later.

steps.title: Make sure you're using the correct login information.
steps.content: Make sure you're using the correct login information. If you input the wrong email address, username, phone number, or password combination, you'll get an error message when trying to log in. If you don't remember your Twitter/X password, you can easily reset it on the login screen. If you don't remember the email address you used, use the password reset function, but try different email addresses until you receive a reset code.

steps.title: Clear your cache.
steps.content: Clear your cache. If your login information is correct and you still can't log in, you may have corrupted data on your device. This can be fixed by clearing the cache on your device. If you're using X in your web browser, clear your browser's cache . On iPhone or iPad, delete the X app and download it again from the App Store . On Android, open your Settings > Apps > X > Storage > Clear cache .

steps.title: Update the X app.
steps.content: Update the X app. Make sure you're running the latest version of the X app. Updates include the latest bug fixes. If you use X in a browser, make sure your browser is updated .
